method.name: GetNspList
method.tp:docstring: Get the list of NSPs visible to this device.

property.name: Nsps
property.tp:docstring: List of object paths of Network Service Providers (NSPs) visible to this WiMAX device.

property.name: CenterFrequency
property.tp:docstring: Center frequency (in KHz) of the radio channel the device is using to communicate with the network when connected. Has no meaning when the device is not connected.

property.name: Rssi
property.tp:docstring: RSSI of the current radio link in dBm. This value indicates how strong the raw received RF signal from the base station is, but does not indicate the overall quality of the radio link. Has no meaning when the device is not connected.

property.name: Cinr
property.tp:docstring: CINR (Carrier to Interference + Noise Ratio) of the current radio link in dB. CINR is a more accurate measure of radio link quality. Has no meaning when the device is not connected.

property.name: TxPower
property.tp:docstring: Average power of the last burst transmitted by the device, in units of 0.5 dBm. i.e. a TxPower of -11 represents an actual device TX power of -5.5 dBm. Has no meaning when the device is not connected.

property.name: Bsid
property.tp:docstring: The ID of the serving base station as received from the network. Has no meaning when the device is not connected.

property.name: ActiveNsp
property.tp:docstring: Object path of the NSP currently used by the WiMax device.

signal.name: PropertiesChanged

arg.name: properties
arg.tp:docstring: A dictionary mapping property names to variant boxed values.

signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when the WiMax device's properties changed.

signal.name: NspAdded

arg.name: nsp
arg.tp:docstring: The object path of the newly found NSP.

signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when a new NSP is found by the device.

signal.name: NspRemoved

arg.name: nsp
arg.tp:docstring: The object path of the NSP that has disappeared.

signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when an NSP disappears from view of the device.
